Suspicious file read/write activity on r.Action: Monitor Windows Event ID 4663 on endpoints for file access events on removable drives. Filter events by drive type (removable). Identify processes accessing files on removable media. Establish baseline processes that normally interact with removable media using frequency analysis. Flag file access by rare or unknown processes. Use time series analysis to detect unusual bursts of read/write activity.

Execution of unusual or unknown processe.Action: Monitor Windows Event ID 4688 on endpoints for process creation events correlated with removable media insertion/mounting times. Use correlation analysis to link the process creation event with a preceding removable device event (if available). Identify process names, command lines, and parent processes. Flag creation of processes with suspicious names, locations (e.g., directly on the removable drive), or those lacking digital signatures. Compare process names against a baseline of commonly executed processes using statistical methods like entropy.
